meta.name: description
meta.content: 4K-12 public school district serving approximately 3,500 students and their families in a community that embraces world-class learning opportunities and rich athletic, arts and co-curricular offerings.

div.title: Mequon and Thiensville Voters Approve $55.7 Million School District Referendum

img.alt: Mequon and Thiensville Voters Approve $55.7 Million School District Referendum

div.a: Mequon and Thiensville Voters Approve $55.7 Million School District Referendum

div.p: “This bold step forward by our community will serve our school district and all residents well into the future,” said MTSD Superintendent of Schools Matthew Joynt, Ph.D.

article.a: Read More About This Article about Mequon and Thiensville Voters Approve $55.7 Million School District Referendum

div.a: Learning From A Distance (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Our schools are closed, but we're still here. Learning is at a distance, but we're still connected.

div.title: MTSD Uses 3D Printing Technology to Produce Critical Components for Respirator Masks

div.a: MTSD Uses 3D Printing Technology to Produce Critical Components for Respirator Masks

div.p: "We are proud of our ability to use the resources we had available at Homestead to be of service to those on the frontlines of the pandemic."

a.title: Non-discrimination and Equal Opportunity
a.data-page-name: Public Notice of Non-discrimination and Equal Employment Opportunity

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

div.p: On April 16, Governor Tony Evers extended the Safer at Home order, indicating that public and private K-12 schools will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year as part of the state’s efforts to respond to and contain the spread of COVID-19 in Wisconsin.
This means that Mequon-Thiensville School District students and staff will not be returning to school campuses this school year.

With the recent announcement, there are many factors that we will need to assess to determine what this means for us moving forward. We are committed to honoring our class of 2020 and finding ways to celebrate the milestones and accomplishments of our students and staff. Watch for more information to come. Our plan is to continue distance learning opportunities in the Mequon-Thiensville School District through the end of the school year.
